articles.description: Manchester City have not won in four matches and are six points behind leaders Arsenal in the Premier League. So what is going wrong for the Treble winners?
articles.title: 'We are struggling' - 'vulnerable' Man City in 'mini crisis'

articles.description: As he lay in a hospital bed recovering from a stroke, Matt Crossen was prepared for the physical battle to return to the football pitch. The mental challenge was more of a surprise.
articles.title: 'If I didn't have my stroke, would I be playing for England?’

articles.description: Will Jacks hits 73 and Sam Curran takes 3-33 as England beat West Indies by six wickets in the second one-day international in Antigua.
articles.title: England return to form to level ODI series against West Indies

articles.description: Aston Villa's deserved victory over Premier League champions Manchester City shows the impact Unai Emery is having at Villa Park, writes Phil McNulty.
articles.title: 'Special Villa are serious Champions League contenders'

articles.description: Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag rejects any talk of a crisis at Old Trafford and insists his side are moving in the right direction.
articles.title: 'Crisis? Not for us,' says Man Utd boss Ten Hag

articles.description: England captain Jos Buttler says he is "getting back to the player that I know I am" after his unbeaten 58 in a six-wicket win over West Indies.
articles.title: 'It was time to put in a performance' - Buttler

articles.description: Liverpool spoil Chris Wilder's Bramall Lane homecoming to remain hot on the heels of Premier League leaders Arsenal.
articles.title: Clinical Liverpool spoil Wilder homecoming

articles.description: Real Madrid to give Kylian Mbappe deadline to accept or reject offer, Tottenham's Richarlison a target for Saudi Pro League, Frank Lampard in frame for Charlotte FC job, plus more.
articles.title: Real to give Mbappe offer deadline - Thursday's gossip

articles.description: Oh Hyeon-gyu scores twice as Celtic swagger to a Scottish Premiership victory over a stunned Hibernian.
articles.title: Oh nets twice as Celtic ease to victory over Hibs

articles.description: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola dismisses pundits' criticism and says his side will win a fourth successive Premier League title.
articles.title: Guardiola responds to Neville, Carragher and Richards comments
